course_title: Professional Practice & Emerging Issues in Occupational Health & Safety

learning_outcomes.description: Apply a model of practice and conceptual framework to reflect on your personal professional practice and potential areas for professional development.
Apply a knowledge of the future of work to identify factors contributing to poor OHS outcomes and to assess/evaluate the hazards and associated risk.
Apply knowledge of leadership, influence, organisational culture, and ethics to OHS practice.
Design and deliver workplace training utilising adult learning principles.
Apply a knowledge of current workers compensation legislation and practice to assess the effectiveness of safe and sustainable return to work programs.
Apply a conceptual framework and problem solving approach to develop recommendations to improve OHS.

assessments.task_description:
Two (2.5) marks will be allocated for participation in guest lecturers and activities. Assessable participation weeks are:

  • Week 7 
  • Week 11 
  • Week 12 
  • Week 13

Students will also be allocated one of these weeks and will be responsible for introducing and thanking the guest speakers.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Students will be provided 4 problems addressing the topics from Week 1 to Week 5. The problem set questions will be provided on Blackboard>Assessments>Problem Sets during Week 2. The assessment item is to be completed in the problem set template provided and uploaded to Turnitin by the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
There are two components to the Workplace Training Presentation:

  1. Students will prepare and submit a written training plan for their workplace oral training presentation. You are required to provide a hard copy of the training plan to the course coordinator on the 10th of September as well as uploading to Turnitin.
  2. Students are to deliver/present workplace training using Adult Learning Principles.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of workplace training plan via Turnitin on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Students will write a 2000 word essay that provides a discussion and commentary on how emerging technologies may impact on OHS practice now and into the future. Students must choose one emerging technology and discuss the impact on OHS practice e.g., artificial intelligence, nanotechnology, mobile devices, drones, digitalisation etc.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
